title: Task 29

question.text: What does Bob mean in his sentence?

answers.answer: He is looking forward to a team meeting.
answers.feedback: This option does not capture the meaning of welcoming new members.

answers.answer: He is pleased with the current team members.
answers.feedback: While this might be true, it doesnâ€™t directly relate to the phrase about new members.

answers.answer: He is happy to welcome new members to the team.
He is planning to introduce new rules to the team.
answers.feedback: The phrase refers to welcoming people, not introducing new rules.

dialogue.text: Well I'm Bob your project manager.
I'm really happy to see new faces joining the team.

description: The expression to see new faces joining the team is often used in a professional or group setting. It means that someone is happy or pleased to welcome new members to a group or team. New faces is a friendly way to refer to new people or members.
